page.title: 13BOXTED HALL TREE GROWING
page.content: There are more trees and hedges on the farm now than for many years.Willow trees are grown and the wood is used to make cricket bats.The thorn hedges had been for keeping the cattle in_cut and lay hedges_but these were being replaced with field maple,ash and crab apple_woods that could be used as fire wood. An experimental area of four acres was being kept for reshearch into the old mettod of pollarding oak trees. This technique has been largely forgotten and it is necessary to find out the best age at which to start polling the oaks. Another experiment on oak trees was the taking off of all side branches at the top rather like a palm tree.The tree grows much quicker and will produce good,knot free timber useful for making furniture.
